moves.4. Nc3:
I decide to play safe, since I am a little unfamiliar with this.

Four knights, Italian variation.
moves.4... Bb4 5. d3: Not worried about Bxc3, cause that will end up being an advantage to me.  The pin will not last long due to my plan to castle.
moves.6... Bxc3: Personally, I don't like trading bishops for knights in the opening till I know how the game will proceed.  The double pawns in the center is actually an asset to me.
moves.7. bxc3 Na5: Ok, I don't want to lose my bishop here needlessly.  Move to b3 and if he takes I can either open the a file or undouble my pawns.
moves.8. Bb3 c5: This creates some weakness on light squares when I have a light bishop.
moves.9... b5: Ok, so he is planning on pushing c4, causing grief for my bishop.  Cannot allow that.
moves.10. a4 Bd7 11. axb5: Perhaps there was a better move, but I didn't see it at the time.  Maybe Bd5
moves.11... Bxb5 12. Bxf6: Bxf6!.  If Qxf6, Rxa5.  gxf6 is force to save the knight.
moves.12... gxf6 13. c4: Turn about is fair play here.  Push the bishop back.
moves.13... Bd7: Really the only logical place to go.
moves.14... Nc6 15. Ba4: Partial pin on the knight through the bishop.
moves.17... Qe7: This stops the threat.  If 18. Qg7 Qf8.  I don't want to trade queens yet cause of my mobility and his exposed king.
moves.18... Qf8 19. Qd2: Not sure, but  probably better would have been Qe3.
moves.19... h5: This move confused me, other than he wants to create space to get his queen and rook on the g file.
moves.21... Ke7 22. Nf5+ Ke8 23. Qe3: Threatening c5 pawn (guarded by knight at d7.)   Also help protect castled position.
moves.23... Qg6: Ok, he's going to line up on the file.  Also the h4 pawn push starts to complicate the game for me by disallowing Ng3 as a defensive move.
moves.24. h4: Possible Nh4 would have been better.
moves.27... Nd7: So this is the 3rd? time the knight has been at this square.  Seems like a waste of a lot of moves.
moves.28... f5: this just offers up a free pawn.  Perhaps he wants to get his knight to f6
moves.29. Nxf5 Nf6 30. Ra5xa7 Rxa7 31. Rxa7: Ok, threatening Ra8 , winning the rook
moves.33. c3: Semi-quiet move, threatening d4 and opening up the center.
moves.33... f6: Creating room for his king and protecting N@e8 with the queen.
moves.34. Nd6: Attacking the pinned knight.  Potential of Rxe8  Qxe8, Nxe8 Kxe8 Qxf6 if his next move doesn't preclude it.
moves.34... Kg7 35. Nf5+: Ok, I want his king on the back rank.
moves.35... Kf7: And he is not going quietly.
moves.36. Ra7+: Trying to push him back on the back rank
moves.38. Qxc5+:
Mate in 2 declared.

if 38. ... Nd6 39. Qxd6  Kg8 40. Qb8#
if 38. ... Nd6 39. Qxd6  Ke8 40. Qb8#
if 38. ... Kg8 39. Qd5  Kf8 40. Qf7#
